definition[0]: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings
example[0]: There was still no news of Jill, and her parents were getting frantic.
example[1]: Your mother’s been frantic with worry wondering where you’ve been.
definition[1]: extremely hurried and using a lot of energy, but not very organized
example[2]: I spent three frantic days trying to get everything ready.
example[4]: a frantic search for her father
example[5]: Despite our frantic efforts, we were unable to save the boy’s life.
example[6]: There was a frantic rush to escape from the building.
definition[2]: if there is frantic trading on the stock market, people buy and sell a lot of currency, shares, COMMODITIES, etc in an urgent and unorganized way
example[7]: The Bundesbank’s assistance was crucial in a day offrantic trading on the currency markets.
example[8]: New York Stock Exchange trading was active but less frantic than on Monday.
